name: UBC Thrifty Grocers
stack: Go, Postman, React, JavaScript, Tailwind CSS
bullets: Engineered high-performance back-end services for a grocery delivery platform using Go, leading to a 40%\ increase in server response speed, while quickly learning the language to contribute effectively to project success.
Conducted extensive API testing using Postman and Bash Scripts, achieving a 100% success rate in test cases, ensuring flawless functionality and reliability of the web application.

Applied security measures (CORS &\ proxies) and implemented access control logic in backend services to ensure users accessed only authorized resources, resulting in a 99%\ error-free deployment rate.
Utilized React to create responsive webpages using Tailwind CSS for 50+ users to easily deliver groceries.
pitch: A grocery delivery platform built for UBC students. Fast backend, secure access control, and a clean React frontend.
keyChallenge: Learned Go from scratch while shipping production features. Focused heavily on API security and proper access control patterns.

name: Oil & Gas Asset Integrity Dashboard
bullets: Built a production-like Power BI solution to monitor integrity KPIs for natural-gas assets: corrosion rate (mmpy), oil content (ppm), SRB levels, overdue inspections, anomaly tracking, certification compliance.
Modeled 24 months of data with Power Query + DAX; implemented role-based views for engineers vs. managers, slicers by department/month/year, and refresh simulation.
Enabled proactive planning with backlog alerts and compliance trend summaries for stakeholder reports.
pitch: Interactive Power BI dashboard for monitoring asset health and maintenance schedules in oil & gas operations.
keyChallenge: Designed data models to handle complex hierarchical asset relationships while keeping queries performant.

name: nwHacks 2024: Comfort Corner
bullets: Led the development of a mental health support website at Western Canada's largest hackathon nwHacks 2024, achieving a top 10 placement with 653 participants.

Successfully integrated OpenAI API to power a specialized chatbot created for mental health assistance, leveraging advanced natural language processing techniques to provide empathetic and accurate support.
Designed and implemented a user-friendly interface featuring quotes and resources, enhancing visitor engagement.
pitch: A mental health support platform with an AI-powered chatbot, built in 24 hours at Western Canada's largest hackathon.
keyChallenge: Integrated OpenAI's API to create empathetic, context-aware responses. Placed top 10 out of 653 participants.

name: Business Tracking Application
bullets: Developed a Java-based application using OOP principles and software development practices to help businesses track purchases and analyze revenue data.
Built an interactive GUI with Java Swing for adding, filtering, and visualizing purchases; implemented unit tests with JUnit to ensure system reliability.
pitch: Desktop app for small businesses to track purchases and visualize revenue trends with an interactive GUI.
keyChallenge: Applied OOP design patterns and built comprehensive unit tests. First experience with full software development lifecycle.

name: Heart Disease Prediction Model
bullets: Built predictive ML model to classify heart disease likelihood based on 300+ patient records.
Applied KNN algorithm after performing data cleaning, feature scaling, and statistical analysis.
Achieved 83% model accuracy and visualized feature impact; emphasized predictive modeling and business insight.
pitch: ML model that predicts heart disease likelihood from patient records using K-Nearest Neighbors classification.
keyChallenge: Learned the importance of feature scaling and data cleaning. Achieved 83% accuracy through careful hyperparameter tuning.

name: CalgaryHacks 2025: WildBC
bullets: Co-developed a web application in a 24-hour hackathon to raise awareness of wildlife conservation in British Columbia in the context of climate change.
Built an interactive map visualizing endangered species and wildfire locations with clickable insights to support public education and engagement.
Implemented a timeline feature to track wildfire events over time, including incidents through 2025.
Created an educational hub with videos, articles, quizzes, and leaderboards to encourage learning through interactive content.
Designed a discussion board to support expert Q&A and community conversations, and integrated event listings for conservation workshops and outreach.
pitch: Web app raising awareness about BC wildlife conservation through interactive maps, timelines, and community features.
keyChallenge: Built in 24 hours with a team. Handled the full-stack integration of maps, timelines, and a discussion board.

name: Production Analytics & Forecasting Dashboard
stack: Python, Streamlit, statsmodels, Plotly, Power Automate
bullets: Built an interactive analytics dashboard to explore and validate time-series operational data (2008â€“2016), improving stakeholder visibility into trends and exceptions.
Developed rolling-origin backtesting to benchmark ETS forecasts vs.\ a seasonal naive baseline, achieving 45% lower MAE and 46% lower RMSE on the default evaluation view.
Supported testing and defect-style validation by implementing a metrics pipeline (MAE, RMSE, MAPE, WAPE) with near-zero handling for stability and clearer interpretation.
Implemented a Power Automate workflow that ingests exported forecast/anomaly CSVs, generates a summary email from templates, and distributes results via Outlook on a scheduled or event-based trigger.
pitch: Time-series analytics dashboard for exploring operational data with built-in forecasting and backtesting tools.
keyChallenge: Implemented rolling-origin backtesting to validate forecasts. Achieved 45% lower error than baseline models.

name: VHS Portfolio
stack: Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, Radix UI
bullets: Built a retro VHS-themed portfolio website with custom animations and effects.
Implemented a boot screen with CRT power-on effects, theme selection, and tape reel animations.
Created a custom TypeWriter component and scanline effects for authentic 80s aesthetics.
pitch: The site you're looking at right now. A retro VHS-themed portfolio with boot sequences, CRT effects, and tape reel animations.
keyChallenge: Designed every interaction to feel like inserting a VHS tape. Built with Next.js, TypeScript, and way too much CSS.
